title: HOLLYWOOD STAR WALK OF FAME
content:
anyone know what the font is for the hollwood star walk of fame?  
anyone know of any good links maybe for a template on how to create it as well in photoshop?

thanks!
author: laughingcolors

comments.content: You haven't posted a sample, but going from memory, isn't it something like [Simpliciter Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306200756/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larstornqvist/simpliciter-sans/) (set in all caps)?

[http://content.answers.com/main/content/wp/en/9/99/Simpsons\_Hollywood\_Wa...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306200756/http:/content.answers.com/main/content/wp/en/9/99/Simpsons_Hollywood_Walk_of_Fame.jpg "http://content.answers.com/main/content/wp/en/9/99/Simpsons\_Hollywood\_Walk\_of\_Fame.jpg")

Actually, the ends aren't rounded. It's an odd typeface.

Oh, right. So much for my memory.

See also: [<cite>JOHN BELUSHI</cite>](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306200756/http:/www.t-cube.ch/moblog/Walk%20of%20Fame%20in%20Hollywood.jpg), [<cite>MICHAEL JACKSON</cite>](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306200756/http:/www.tu-bs.de:8080/~y0019202/images/USATrip/California/RIMG0268.JPG), [<cite>KERMIT THE FROG</cite>](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306200756/http:/www.legendsofamerica.com/photos-california/Hollywood-walk-of-fame.jpg).

That's a strange <cite>S</cite>.
it almost looked like helvetica to met at first guess

Century Gothic, Futura Condensed, and Avant Garde Condensed could get you close.

- Lex

Definitely not Helvetica with an "R" like that. Oddly compressed "S" in both "JACKSON" and "BELUSHI"...

Yes, it is indeed odd.
